panels.content:

Select a specific location using the "Locations" dropdown menu at left.

The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.
panels.title: General information

panels.description:
MODIS-Aqua 1km chlor_a product (mg/m^3) binned to 7-day intervals.
Anomaly images created by subtracting 7-day climatologies made using data from 2003-2017.
panels.title: MODIS-Aqua CHLa 7-Day anomaly images (mg/m^3)
MODIS-Aqua remote sensing reflectance at 667nm 7-Day anomaly images (sr^-1)

alert.message: Unusually high FL bay river discharge this month
alert.name: High discharge into Florida Bay alert

panels.title: River discharge into Florida Bay (combined discharge from gages shown as green circles on map)
In-situ salinity (psu) from Peterson Key buoy (yellow circle on map)
In-situ temperature (DegC) at 0.5m from Peterson Key buoy

panels.content:
* Satellite data is from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS-Aqua) sensor and is obtained from the [Ocean Biology Processing Group](https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/) at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

* Algal Bloom Index (ABI) is calculated using the method of Hu and Feng (2016; doi: 10.1117/1.JRS.11.012003) 

* River discharge data is obtained from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis). Discharge values from the Shark, Harney, Broad, Lostman's and Chatham Rivers (green circles on map above) are summed for discharge into Florida Bay shown on plot above.

* Buoy at Peterson Key is operated by the National Park Service and data is obtained from the [National Data Buoy Center.](https://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/) 

Please feel free to contact us with questions or to sign up for email alerts:

Dr. Daniel Otis - [dotis@mail.usf.edu](mailto:dotis@mail.usf.edu)
